intro: Lastrea macroura, commonly known as the long-tongued lastrea, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant features fleshy, cylindrical stems that store water, and it produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in arid environments and is adapted to full sun exposure. Its unique morphology and drought tolerance make it a popular choice for xeriscaping and rock gardens.
